stack:stack.stack:script:
mkdir -p /etc/security/ca mkdir -p /etc/security/ca/new-certs
[ req ] default_bits = 2048 default_md = sha512 string_mask = nombstr # permitted characters distinguished_name = req_distinguished_name
[ v3_ca ] basicConstraints = CA:TRUE subjectKeyIdentifier = hash authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid:always,issuer:always
[ req_distinguished_name ] 0.organizationName = Organization Name (company) organizationalUnitName = Organizational Unit Name (department, division) localityName = Locality Name (city, district) stateOrProvinceName = State or Province Name (full name) countryName = Country Name (2 letter code) countryName_min = 2 countryName_max = 2 commonName = Common Name (hostname, IP, or your name)
commonName_default = &Info_FQDN; organizationalUnitName_default = &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;-CA 0.organizationName_default = &settings.ssl.organization; localityName_default = &settings.ssl.locality; stateOrProvinceName_default = &settings.ssl.state; countryName_default = &settings.ssl.country;

if [ ! -f /etc/security/ca/ca.key ] then ( cd /etc/security/ca; \ /usr/bin/openssl req -new -x509 -extensions v3_ca -nodes \ -keyout ca.key -days 5000 -batch -config ca.cfg > ca.crt; \ chmod 0400 ca.key; \ chmod 0444 ca.crt; \ echo "01" > ca.serial ) fi
chmod 0750 /etc/security/ca chmod 0770 /etc/security/ca/new-certs chmod 0664 /etc/security/ca/ca.serial chmod 0440 /etc/security/ca/ca.key chmod 0640 /etc/security/ca/ca.cfg
chgrp -R apache /etc/security/ca
